intro: Dysosma versipellis, commonly known as the golden thread fern, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are often greenish-yellow in color. Dysosma versipellis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its unique morphology and medicinal properties make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
